Sections.title: Welcome
Sections.content:
The Curriculum Vitae of Joe Buckle

I am a self taught, self motivated full stack web developer seeking a full time role working with JavaScript frameworks.

I have a particular interest in React + Redux.
(in fact this CV is developed using it)

Sections.title: What I've been doing
Sections.content:
For a little over 10 years I have been running a small agency that has been developing, supporting and hosting websites and apps for various companies and organisations.

As I was pretty much the only developer I had to adapt to differing needs. This meant that sometimes I would be working with PHP, WordPress and MySQL and another time I may be working with Python, Django and PostgreSQL.

In addition to this I would also set up hosting environments. Some would need to support heavy traffic with minimal processing and others not so much traffic but with heavy processing.

Sections.title: What I want to do
Sections.content:
I've ultimately decided that running an agency is not for me.

In fact, what I really want to do is focus on my craft - to become the best at it I can be.

I'm most excited about JavaScript and I would love a full time position working with it but I can also be useful to a company who might be looking to migrate from a Python or PHP based website or app to JavaScript.

Sections.title: About my skills
Sections.content:
Although I am self taught, I have used online study material and taken deep dives into some of the technology that I use. There are some areas that I know more about than others.

I have a deep understanding of core JavaScript and PHP and a good understanding of React + Redux, Express, Laravel, WordPress, MySQL.

I am also pretty good with vanilla Python and Django framework and I've taken steps towards understanding developing for Wagtail CMS.

I am constantly exploring technology and how I can improve my skills to become more useful.

Sections.title: What I can offer
Sections.content:
Whilst I bring quite a few years experience with me and some important skills - in addition I am always trying to be helpful, useful and as accommodating as possible.

I am very committed and I take pride in the work I do.

I have to deal with the end users in my current role so I have a good understanding of their needs.

I have also been told I make a nice cup of tea.

Sections.title: Some personal stuff
Sections.content:
When I'm not writing code I am an occasional marathon runner and train for such events. This year I have attempted 2 ultra marathons, the first I had to end at 26 miles due to a knee injury and the second I succeeded in finishing. I also enjoy participating in and watching boxing.

I also have an interest in cooking (and eating!) healthy food and enjoy a nice craft lager fairly regularly.
